article_title: Obama Pledges to Bolster Europe's Security
article_text:
WARSAW—President Barack Obama said he would increase joint exercises and send more U.S. military equipment to Eastern Europe, proposing a new $1 billion fund Tuesday to bolster European security and reassure newer U.S. allies worried by what they see as a renewal of Russian aggression.

Mr. Obama's announcement, at the start of a four-day European trip, came alongside a decision by European defense ministers meeting in Brussels to...

twitter.description: President Barack Obama proposed a new $1 billion fund Tuesday to bolster European security, part of his latest attempt to reassure nervous allies that the U.S. would act if what it calls Russia's aggression in Ukraine spreads to other parts of the region.
twitter.creator: @CarolELee

image.alt: Obama proposes $1 billion fund to increase U.S. military presence in Eastern Europe.
